channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #95 - Spring is here, Perl 5.18.0 is out!
item.description:
Hi

On 5.18 Perl 5.18 was released. (If this goes on, I wonder when will 5.32 be released ??) You can download the source code and build it yourself or, if you use Windows, you can grab Strawberry Perl! In either case, let's use this opportunity to thank all the people who were involved in the development and release of Perl 5.18!

Last week I got notified that I missed the French Perl Workshop from the list. Now it is corrected. Please note it is less than a month from now. If you don't want to wait till then, the Polish Perl Workshop is this week!

That's it for now by Gabor. Now let me pass the keyboard to `/anick, who put together most of this issue:

item.title: Mojolicious 4.0 released: Perl real-time web framework
item.description: Sebastian Riedel announces the release of Mojolicious 4.0, and with it a list of equally delicious new features.

item.title: Anyone want vanillaperl.com?
item.description: David Golden owns the domain name 'vanillaperl.com', but don't really have a use for it. Have a good idea for it? Chime in, and the domain could be yours!

item.title: Perl 5.18 is out!
item.description: Take a moment to read the changelog, fire up perlbrew and, if applicable, point and laugh at any poor schmuck close by still stuck on 5.6.

item.title: Strawberry Perl 5.18.0.1 released
item.description: You hardly had time to download the source code of Perl 5.18.0, KMX already created the Strawberry Perl package for Windows!

item.title: Advice to a new Perl user
item.description: Perl and Windows? Is it long-term skills? How to carve a niche for yourself? A new Perl user has questions, brian d foy answers them, Dear Abby-style.

item.title: Cleaning up the Test::Class::Moose base class
item.description: A new version of Test::Class::Moose is out. Ovid walks us through the new, cleaner class-to-test-file interface it provides.

item.title: Perl tokens you should know
item.description: You're probably aware of the token '__PACKAGE__'. But do you know you can also access the current file, and line of code? What about the embedded data stream?

item.title: Escape::Houdini and Related Tales of Prestidigitation
item.description: Yanick announces the appearance of a new fast web escaping module on the scene.

item.title: POP3 with TLS in Perl
item.description: Mike B points out that Net::SSLGlue now support POP3 with TLS security.

item.title: New And Improved: GitStore Meets MooseX::Storage
item.description: Yanick touts a new release of GitStore, which provides a nice interface to MooseX::Storage, and thus makes storing Moose objects into a Git repository a breeze.

item.title: psgi applications easy install with chef
item.description: How easy is it to install psgi-based applications using Chef? Pretty darn easy, according to melezhik's examples.

item.title: Interview with John SJ Anderson (aka genehack)
item.description: Gabor Szabo is on an interview roll. This time, it's genehack's turn.

item.title: My "Mojolicious Introduction" now updated for 4.0
item.description: Grasping the opportunity for serendipisism, Joel Berger has updated his Mojolicious introduction slide-deck for Mojolicious 4.0.

item.title: Rakudo on JVM progress update, and some questions answered
item.description: Jonathan Worthington keeps us up-to-date with what is happening in the world of Rakudo.

item.title: Quicksort golf
item.description: The Haskell community prides itself in being able to implement the quicksort algorithm in a succint yet elegant way. Dominic Humphries shows that Perl ain't too shabby for it either.

item.title: Solving the Balanced Brackets task using Perl 6 - Part 1
item.description: Rohan Almeida tackles this classic coding exercise, and by the same token provides us with a nifty example of Perl 6 programming.

item.title: Grant Application: Maintaining Perl 5
item.description: This time by Tony Cook

item.title: Strings in Perl: quoted, interpolated and escaped
item.description: Do you know how what is the difference between single-quote and double-quote in Perl? Do you know how to use q and qq?

item.title: Using a queue in Perl
item.description: Do you know what FIFO is, and how to implement one in Perl?

item.title: Polish Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: May 25-26, 2013, Warsaw, Poland

item.title: YAPC::NA 2013
item.description: June 3-5, 2013, Austin, Texas, USA

item.title: French Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: June 14-15, 2013, Nancy, France

item.title: YAPC::EU 2013
item.description: August 12-14, 2013, Kiev, Ukraine
